data.title: Canadian DJ Deadmau5's El Paso show sells out quickly, second show added
data.meta_description: Deadmau5, one of the most well-known electronic music producers, is coming to El Paso. The first show sold out. Find out about the second show.
data.text:
Canadian music producer Deadmau5 will be pumping his electronic dance music to a sold-out El Paso crowd later this year. It is an 18+ show.

The Canadian progressive-house producer, who wears his iconic "mau5head" mask, will be in town on Dec. 19 at 11:11, 9740 Dyer Suite 117, according to the club's Instagram account. And within a few hours, the show has sold out.

Deadmau5 adds second show at 11:11

After the quick sell-out, 11:11 announced on its Instagram that a second show was being added. The second show will be Dec. 18. Tickets will go on sale at 11 a.m. Monday, July 22. Fans can sign up for alerts about tickets at discopresents.com/mau5

Deadmau5, whose real name is Joel Zimmerman, is considered one of the world's most respected electronic music producers, according to edmtunes. He has released seven critically acclaimed albums and has enjoyed international chart success with two times platinum-certified single 'Ghosts 'n' Stuff'.

With several social media channels, his fan base reaches more than 15 million fans. He has appeared at the largest music festivals, including Coachella and Bonaroo in Australia. He did appear in El Paso in 2016, helping El Pasoans celebrate the new year at the New Year's Eve bash, Lights All Night EDM Festival.

Earlier this year, he celebrated 25 years of Deadmau5 shows sold out at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles and the Brooklyn Mirage in New York City. He also debuted a new single, Quezacotl, which should appeal to long-time fans.

By the way, Deadmau5 has a long list of remixes, including "I Remember" with Kaskade, who was just spotted in El Paso.

Deadmau5 Tour in El Paso tickets sell out within hours

As of 1 p.m. July 17, tickets for the Deadmau6 appearance at 11:11 were sold out. They ranged from $59.95 to $69.95, plus fees, and were sold at www.seetickest.us

More: Rock for Ruidoso benefit concert raises money for those affected by New Mexico wildfires
